name: you
description: you

name: world
description: world

name: saved_game
description: save found. would you like to resume where you left off?
onVerb_description: loading save...|...

name: title
description:
drift mine satellite

a maintenance text adventure

name: bed_made
description: a four-poster. ornate against the metal walls.
onVerb_description: falling asleep|all hung with curtains and sheets. a hand-made luxury, scavenged and patched.

name: bed_unmade
description: curtains pulled back, pillows piled in the middle.
onVerb_description: falling asleep|you tuck in the sheets, and fold the rumpled comforters over them. 2 comforters, and a quilt. it is always a little cold here for you.

name: rug
description: in mille-fleur style. threadbare and a little dirty, but expensive, once. you pulled it from the archives, when they held more than they do now.
onVerb_description: sitting on the rug, tracing the stems of your thousand flowers.

name: mirror
description: it's you.
onVerb_description: you point the polaroid at your reflection and release the shutter. it spits out a white square, on which your face slowly forms.

name: photograph
description: a photograph of you, framed in your bedroom mirror. it is a little blurry, but unmistakably you.

name: library_card
description: a photograph of you, framed in your bedroom mirror. on the back is written "INTERLIBRARY LOAN: ONE 1962 MAGNAVOX PORTABLE RECORD PLAYER"

name: door
description: leaving your home

name: modem
description: gently blinking, green and red lights. like christmas.

name: computer
description: an old HP laptop. the hinges are busted, but it works fine if you don't try to move it.
onVerb_description: password: ***********

name: copper_wire
description: a length, handmade, that you've wrapped around a pencil.

name: copper_cables
description: snake-like, pulled from the walls of a disused boat. spliced together, in places, to make a longer thread.
onVerb_description: you braid a few strands, crimping the edges.

name: tools
description: your trade spread out on the table. clippers, awl, pliers, drill. potentiometer. running on a dwindling supply of AA's.
onVerb_description: you pull your stone against the cutting edges.|to carry with you.

name: dream_1
description: standing on the porch in the morning.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_2
description: the sound of birds out the window.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_3
description: walking city streets.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_4
description: it is snowing.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_5
description: a fox stands in the front yard, looking at you.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_6
description: the ocean. tides, waves. smell of salt.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_7
description: a fire in your childhood home.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_8
description: laying in the grass. moths in the flowers.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_9
description: a smiling waitress takes your order. coffee, pancakes.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_10
description: sitting on the steps of a museum. the sky is very blue.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_11
description: trying to explain why you cut your hair. failing. crying in frustration.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_12
description: wolves.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_13
description: schoolyard. it is almost summer. the asphalt is hot.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_14
description: a planet hanging low and close in the sky above the bluff.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_15
description: a house full of animals. they all need to be fed.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_16
description: eating a fresh peach.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_17
description: lost in a city. mountains in the distance.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_18
description: running down a hill, tripping, catching yourself on air, flying, laughing.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_19
description: a swan paddles circles on the lake.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: dream_20
description: lost in a graphical interface. dream of clicking.
onVerb_description: coming back

name: games
description: snake. solitaire. minesweeper.

name: mail_1
description:
inbox: 3

from: horsegirl45
subject: IMPORTANT. open asap.

haha, gotcha! no but really, this is important‚Äì it‚Äôs my birthday tonight and if you don‚Äôt come to the party I‚Äôll never forgive you. bring something nice for me, okay?

name: mail_2
description:
inbox: 2

from: eddyboy
subject: continuing failures in the transmission lines

listen, remember how we were running into issues with the voltage dropping for no particular reason? I think I might have a solution‚Ä¶ come visit me near the generators by the lake.

name: mail_3
description:
inbox: 1

from: space_cadet1
subject: your help with the GPS positioning

need your expertise when you have a minute. will you come by? bring your toolbox.

name: mail_empty
description: inbox: 0

name: network
description: honestly, a lot of outages... probably half the network is offline?

name: files
description: 1,231,571 items. arranged in folders.

name: log_out
description: logging out . . . .

name: trash
description: draft proposal for a garden watering schedule. a letter you wrote while angry (filename: DONOTOPEN.txt). 27 selfies. a jpeg of a goat.
onVerb_description: good riddance.

name: empty_trash
description: 0 items.

name: north
description: following the tunnel north

name: train_car
description: your house.
onVerb_description: going home|a passenger car from a regional railway. still has its graffiti. you've hung curtains in the windows.

name: belltower
description: you built this -  bicycle frames welded together into a haphazard tower, with the cast iron ship's bell hanging from the top. used to be, you'd climb up to hit it with hammers. now there's a new clapper.
onVerb_description: a slightly different angle on the room. your train car looks smaller from here, caught in the limestone hollow. you think again how lucky you are to have such high ceilings.|you cannot ring it‚Äì there's no bell pull.|you climb up and fasten the cordage to the bell. it reaches almost to the ground.
onVerb_dialog: a melodic sound, muted from the leather clapper. back when you used the bell for messages, the clapper was sharp metal and would echo for miles down the tunnels.

name: belltower_2
description: you built this -  bicycle frames welded together into a haphazard tower, with the cast iron ship's bell hanging from the top. used to be, you'd climb up to hit it with hammers. now there's a new clapper.
onVerb_description: a slightly different angle on the room. your train car looks smaller from here, caught in the limestone hollow. you think again how lucky you are to have such high ceilings.|a melodic sound, muted from the leather clapper. back when you used the bell for messages, you'd hit the bell with sharp metal. it would echo for miles down the tunnels.

name: junk_pile_2
description: an accumulation of objects and scrap, pulled from the tunnels, archives, vehicles. much of it electronic. some of it conductive. little of it beautiful - but not none of it.
onVerb_description: a little glass marble.

name: junk_pile_3
description: an accumulation of objects and scrap, pulled from the tunnels, archives, vehicles. much of it electronic. some of it conductive. little of it beautiful - but not none of it.
onVerb_description: a length of rope.

name: marble
description: blue and clear. like the sky.

name: rope
description: hand-braided, out of miscellaneous cordage‚Äì kale stems, plastics, fabric.

name: east
description: following the tunnel east

name: interior_door
description: heavy, bolted metal. would take several people to move it.

name: exterior_door
description: the exterior door. it's been some time since you've seen it.

name: rv_room
description: roomier on the inside. a lace doily on every surface.

name: off_television_set
description: a bulbous black and white set in its own, faux-wood, cabinet.
onVerb_description: you point the remote at the television and click. it turns on, but no image resolves.

name: broken_television_set
description: currently showing static.
onVerb_description: you pry off the casing with a flathead screwdriver and discharge the anode.

name: open_television_set
description: the plastic case is open and the tube is sitting on the table. a wire connecting to the antennae has... melted?
onVerb_description:
you cut out the section of blackened wire and patch in some of the bright copper instead. you reassemble the television.

ms. borowski will be thrilled.

name: fixed_television_set_owls
description: picking up a movie being broadcast from the archives. an experimental documentary about owl rehabilitation.

name: fixed_television_set_rose
description: picking up a movie being broadcast from the archives. a play set in a monastery.

name: fixed_television_set_bonsai
description: picking up a movie being broadcast from the archives. a man stands on a cliff, describing a juniper shrub.

name: fixed_television_set_mad_max
description: picking up a movie being broadcast from the archives. fast cars in the night.

name: mb_bed
description: fluffy, down comforters, quilts.

name: dinette
description: set with knife and fork. plasticine chairs.

name: door
description: exiting the rv
onVerb_description: exiting the rv

name: south
description: following the tunnel south

name: solarPanel
description: pretty aspirational, given the setting.
onVerb_description: oh, it's been turned into a picnic table... you can see the rings from coffee cups.

name: solarPanel_inspected
description: bolted onto table legs. makes for a nice centerpiece.
onVerb_description: cool under your hand. a doily in the center.

name: rv
description: a skyline camper. string lights extending from the frame.
onVerb_description: entering the rv|in remarkably good shape. must not have ever been on the highway.

name: remote
description: rounded like the television. not very many buttons.

name: msBorowski
description: she is wearing a pale dress. or a nightgown? curlers, anyhow.

name: msBorowski_dialog_1
description: oh, nice to see your face, as always.|are you here to look at the television? I've been having trouble with it all day.
replies: sure. I could take a look at it.|I'm sorry... I'll have to come back later.
onVerb_description: oh, that's wonderful. the set's inside. and here's the remote, in case you need it.|

name: msBorowski2
description: she looks vaguely expectant.

name: msBorowski_dialog_2
description: thanks again for agreeing to look at the television.|it's inside. you can't miss it. really ties the room together.

name: msBorowski3
description: she looks hopeful.

name: msBorowski_dialog_3
description: you're saying you actually fixed it? ohohoho! that's the best news I've had all day. | ... like a guardian angel... | ...... | oh, sorry, got lost in thought there. here, don't leave empty handed. my thanks.

name: msBorowski5
description: she is watching the television set. content.

name: msBorowski6
description: she is watching the television set. content.

name: msBorowski_dialog_6
description: what was that, hon? the party is going to start? | well, you know I wouldn't miss it for anything. | I'll see you there.

name: msBorowski7
description: smiling serenely.

name: cake
description: a black forest cake. extravagant. chocolatey.

description: following the tunnel north

name: south
description: following the tunnel south

description: following the tunnel west

description: following the tunnel east

name: west
description: following the tunnel west

name: east
description: following the tunnel east

name: tunnel_wall
description: a sheer face of limestone, left by the excavators when this was a mine. there's only so much rock you can pull out of a mountain before the whole thing collapses‚Äì the tunnels are evidence of that.

name: south
description: going to the train car

name: street_lamp
description: sodium bulbs. straight out of the suburbs. the light cast is yellow, and steals all color.
onVerb_description: there's a faint fuzz of moss growing in the circle of cast light. the spectrum of the bulb must be just-wide enough for it. rare to see a plant volunteer to grow. it's kind of nice.

name: west
description: following the tunnel west

name: east
description: following the tunnel east

name: rolling_chair
description: plastic, flaking.

name: card_table
description: an in-progress game of go fish, you assume. it is so dark you can't see the cards, or the players.

name: card_table_2
description: pile of cards in the center of the table.

name: folding_chair
description: metal, rusty.

name: broken_lamp
description: a floor lamp. it is off.
onVerb_description: you screw in the light bulb. the room flickers into relief.|you screw in the light bulb. the room flickers into relief.

name: fixed_lamp
description: a floor lamp. it is giving off a soft, warm light.

name: burned_out_bulb
description: a glass bubble, darkened inside with ash.

name: cain_1
description: go fish.

name: cain_2
description: got any jacks?

name: cain_3
description: wearing a plaid shirt.

name: cain_4
description: holding a full hand of cards.

name: cain_5
description: nodding at the scene.

name: cain_dialog_1
description: who's that? who's there? speak!
replies: are you... playing cards in the dark? | ...

name: cain_dialog_2
description: oh it's you. | well. good enough. | light went out a while back, but of course I couldn't just leave my cards here unguarded to go rummaging around for a new bulb. | abel's a cheat, you know. would take advantage.
replies: I could find you a bulb?
onVerb_description: oh, would you? you're a real pal, you know. here, take this‚Äì I know I've got some bulbs in my rv.

name: cain_dialog_3
description: ha! lights on! you did it! | abel, the age of mischief ends now. | come on, don't tell me you didn't try to replace a king with a six in the dark.

name: cain_dialog_4
description: the party is on?? well, why didn't anyone tell me? | ... you are telling me? well... can't argue with that!

name: abel_1
description: got any eights?

name: abel_2
description: go fish.

name: abel_3
description: sporting a popped collar.

name: abel_4
description: down to a single card.

name: abel_5
description: arm linked with cain's.

name: abel_dialog_1
description: wait. wait. is someone there?

name: abel_dialog_2
description: ah, it's you! well, you're not so bad. | look, look here‚Äì our lamp went out a bit ago, mid-game. but obviously I can't just quit halfway through... that'd be a forfeit. | would you mind getting a new bulb? I've got one stashed in my rv.
onVerb_description: go ahead and take this‚Äì pretty sure I locked up today.

name: abel_dialog_3
description: oh, that's better. thanks for going to the trouble.|I'm looking forward to my 53rd consecutive win being witnessed in the light.

name: abel_dialog_4
description: the party's starting? ha! count me in!

name: abels_rv_key
description: it has a plastic starfish keychain.

name: cains_rv_key
description: "ford mobile traveler" is stamped on the plastic.

name: north
description: following the tunnel north

name: south
description: following the tunnel south

name: cricket
description: little chirping cave cricket. you get them sometimes. the sound is annoying, but... also somehow sweet.

name: east
description: following the tunnel east

name: south
description: following the tunnel south

name: east
description: following the tunnel east

name: west
description: following the tunnel west

name: food_scraps
description: kitchen scraps and leftovers just on this edge of passable, mostly. people keep their bits and pieces. bring it by on their walks. it's good to feed a goat.
onVerb_description: you poke around the scraps pile, looking for the most edible bits. it's a bit smelly.

name: goat_food
description: a corn cob. stems of chard. carrot ends. the bottom inch of a can of beans, warmed directly on the stove. a little burned, but not bad for a goat.

name: north
description: going to visit the goat

name: south
description: following the tunnel south

name: fence
description: the first version of this fence was made with cardboard tubes pulled from the archive, but the goat ate those. now it is stone. three and half feet tall. easy to feed a goat over.

name: goat_shit
description: little pellets in a pile on the stone floor.
onVerb_description: you scoop the droppings into your bucket. good fertilizer for the garden.

name: goat
description: square pupils. patient chewing. moonspotted.
onVerb_description: you dig into your pockets and come up with the food scraps from before. the goat wastes no time in relishing the treats. good goat.

name: goat_2
description: square pupils. patient chewing. moonspotted.
onVerb_description: goat... come to angela's party. there will be cake.

name: goat_3
description: he's got hold of a paper streamer. it's half eaten.

name: east
description: following the tunnel east

name: west
description: following the tunnel west

name: family car
description: a 4-door buick sedan. plush seats. 8 track player.

name: south
description: following the tunnel south

name: west
description: following the tunnel west

name: east
description: following the tunnel east

name: compost_pile
description: scraps even the goat wouldn't eat. and some that the goat did.

name: fertilizer
description: sifted from the bottom of the compost heap. smells rich in this dry, dusty place.

name: east
description: following the tunnel east

name: west
description: following the tunnel west

name: north
description: going to ms. borowski's

name: light_1
description: banks of long glass tubes, low over the garden.

name: light_2
description: fixtures tied together with handmade rope and hung from hooks driven into the ceiling.

name: herbs
description: cilantro, poppies, garlic. it's not a very cohesive set of flavors. but you were limited to what you had in the spice cabinet.

name: vegetables
description: pumpkins, green beans, red peppers. potatoes. a few pea shoots, recently rescued from a bag of dried peas that had, miraculously, not been split. everyone is hoping they make it.

name: greens_bed
description: lettuce, arugula, cress. mustard greens. there's been an attempt at selecting the mustard towards something more like kale. limited results.

name: pumpkin
description: a round orange fruit. rings hollow when you give it a thunk.
onVerb_description: you snap the pumpkin off the vine.

name: flower
description: a poppy. breadseed, but blooms beautiful all the same.
onVerb_description: you cut the flower head- just the one.

name: garden
description: truth told, it's not a very impressive affair. it takes a lot of power to run even these lights. but it's a place to put the work in, and what little green does make it to dinner plates is well-loved.

name: east
description: following the tunnel east

name: west
description: following the tunnel west

name: angela
description: dressed in overalls and rubber boots. hair in braids.

name: angela_dialog_1
description: aw, you come to help me set up for the party?

name: angela_dialog_2
description: too bad! the birthday girl shouldn't have to do all the work herself.|here's what's left on my list: music. decorations. birthday cake. guests.
replies: that sounds like pretty much... everything?

name: angela_dialog_3
description: right again. you'll help me out, yeah? it's my birthday after all.

name: angela_2
description: dressed in overalls and rubber boots. hair in braids.
verbs_display: give angela the record player | give angela the decorations | give angela the cake
onVerb_description: you set the record player from the librarian on the floor.|you hang the star projector from a hook in the ceiling.|you place the cake from ms. borowski on a table.

name: angela_sp_c
description: dressed in overalls and rubber boots. hair in braids.
verbs_display: give angela the decorations | give angela the cake
onVerb_description: you hang the star projector from a hook in the ceiling.|you place the cake from ms. borowski on a table.

name: angela_rp_c
description: dressed in overalls and rubber boots. hair in braids.
verbs_display: give angela the record player | give angela the cake
onVerb_description: you set the record player from the librarian on the floor.|you place the cake from ms. borowski on a table.

name: angela_rp_sp
description: dressed in overalls and rubber boots. hair in braids.
verbs_display: give angela the record player | give angela the decorations
onVerb_description: you set the record player from the librarian on the floor|you hang the star projector from a hook in the ceiling.

name: angela_rp
description: dressed in overalls and rubber boots. hair in braids.
onVerb_description: you set the record player from the librarian on the floor.

name: angela_sp
description: dressed in overalls and rubber boots. hair in braids.
onVerb_description: you hang the star projector from a hook in the ceiling.

name: angela_c
description: dressed in overalls and rubber boots. hair in braids.
onVerb_description: you place the cake from ms. borowski on a table.

name: angela_all
description: looking around the room approvingly.

name: angela_dialog_4
description: wow... you got everything. | it's... it's really looking nice in here. like a party. | like my party. | just one last thing missing: our friends. | can you go tell everyone we're ready now?

name: angela_ready
description: wearing a paper birthday crown. beaming.

name: angela_dialog_5
description: once everyone's here, and we're ready to kick things off... well, why don't you do the honors? | you kind of made it possible, after all. | turn on the star projector and spin the record. that's a birthday to me.

name: school_bus
description: a bluebird model, now actually painted blue.

name: firepit
description: a ring of blackened stones around a firepit that hasn't been used in some time. what's left to burn?

name: star_projector_2
description: a light projects outwards from a dome of cut stars. pinpricks of light are cast on every surface.
onVerb_description: you press the switch on the star projector.

name: record_player_2
description: a magnavox portable player. it is painted baby blue.
onVerb_description: you drop the needle on the record. take a beat. and begin to dance.

name: bus_seats
description: pulled out of the bus, they've been drilled into the floor.

name: horse_trailer
description: a horse-hauler, renovated into a comfortable enough bedroom.

name: east
description: following the tunnel east

name: west
description: following the tunnel west

name: south
description: following the tunnel south

name: trash pile
description: bits of wood, fabric, metal, glass, plastic. little usable. bigger pieces have already been integrated into homes or decoration, or‚Äì in the case of anything copper‚Äì soldered into the wires that skirt the walls of the tunnels.
onVerb_description:
you find yourself here sometimes, looking for a particular shape of thing.
tiny machine screws.
a square of bright blue cotton.
a wedge of plastic to shove under a sagging window.

it is why the pile is still here, and not in the lake.| you kick at the pile with the toe of your boot until a piece of plastic piping works itself free. always useful.

name: piping
description: a little piece of plastic tubing, requisitioned from a coffee maker.

name: west
description: following the tunnel west

name: shrine
description:
photographs and garlands.
stacked stones, coins, a cross or two.
a dried flower.
a carved wooden horse.
a bottle of liquor- just a little bit left, in the very bottom.
candles, now wax.
onVerb_description: and letters, countless letters, held down with stones and pinned to objects and tied to the garlands. prayers, wishes, unsent mail to loved ones elsewhere.|you place your cut flower among the remembrances.

name: end of tunnel
description: the tunnel narrows and then stops. the wall is still scratched with the markings of an excavator, turned to heel.

name: east
description: following the tunnel east

name: west
description: following the tunnel west

name: cat
description: a little calico.
onVerb_description: you bend over and scratch under her chin. she purrs.

name: cat_2
description: curled up. purring.
onVerb_description: would you like to come to the party, little cat?

name: cat_3
description: on top of the trailer, watching the scene.

name: south
description: following the tunnel south

name: astronomer
description: wearing glasses so thick they look like the telescope lenses. maybe they are telescope lenses. the better to see through stone with.

name: astronomer_dialog_1
description: ah, you made it ... | good, good, no it's good, I'm sorry, it's just ... | I've been up all night with the telescope. the data isn't making sense anymore.

name: astronomer_dialog_2
description: okay, so, used to be we'd set location from the GPS pings. sent down from the navigation satellites. they're still running up there, you know! all on solar, whole network of them. | and of course, the telescope's got a computer in, all the location calculation happens automatic. stable as a rock. | and since we know where we are, we know where everything else is. well, sure, not the stuff that has random action... but stable things, things with orbits. planets. stars. galaxies. | sure, we can't see jupiter, but you can trust if the scope is pointed at it, it's there.
replies: but the data isn't right anymore...?

name: astronomer_dialog_3
description: that's just the trouble. | recently, well... I do always track the trajectories on paper too, something to keep the hands busy, and, um... god, how to say this. | we're drifting. as far as I can tell. | jupiter should be THERE but instead the computer thinks it's HERE. | and I checked the scope, nothing wrong with it at all. it's the pings that have it reorienting the calculations. our location. we've moved halfway around the world. | which means... are we moving? or... are the satellites desyncing? or... am I just an old fool... getting my calculations wrong.....
replies: have you tried a hard reset?

name: astronomer_dialog_4
description: well... we could try to contact the satellites directly. see if we couldn't seed them with our last location.|there's the radio equipment in the archives. but we'd need a lot of power to send a signal through all that rock. a lot more than we've used in years. since the S.O.S days.|but you... you set up the S.O.S signal originally, right? you could do it again?

name: astronomer_dialog_5
description: well. we'd need to get all the generators running at full capacity. and then we'd need to encode a ping in a format we could send... | tell you what, you work on the generators. I'll start in on the signal. | let me know when we've got power. | and, uh... take this. in case... you need to free up some power. temporarily. | don't break anything you can't fix.

name: astronomer_2
description: wearing glasses so thick they look like the telescope lenses. maybe they are telescope lenses. the better to see through stone with.

name: astronomer_dialog_6
description: I see you got the generators back online. | noticed the power surge from here. well done. | and not to worry - I haven't been wasting my time. look at this. | it's a synchronization program. you should be able to hook it right up to the radio tower in the archives.

name: astronomer_3
description: furrowed brow, steepled hands.

name: astronomer_dialog_7
description: I got the synchronization data back. | we're not drifting. neither are the satellites, same orbits as ever. | but... they'd desynced from one another. which means, they're not talking to the ground stations anymore. | which means... there aren't ground stations anymore. not powered, working ones, anyway.
replies: what... does that mean for us?

name: astronomer_dialog_7_5
description: I'm... not really sure what it means for us. | I guess it means we can stop with the S.O.S. probably nobody's coming. | but, you know... we already had stopped, somewhere between the garden and the cat, the archives and the chores, well... it got kind of busy down here. | ... I'm glad the telescope's working again, anyway. thanks for that.

name: astronomer_dialog_8
description: oh, listen, I was thinking‚Äì maybe you can get this star projector fixed up for me?|you know, it's angela's birthday today and she used to love it... when she was little... and I thought.... |well, it shouldn't take too much to fix. just needs new glass, I think.

name: astronomer_4
description: engrossed in work.

name: astronomer_dialog_9
description: it's time for the party already? alright, alright, let me just finish up a few things... | shouldn't be a moment ..... | just, uh, a second more ..... | .............. | alright. alright, I'll get back to this later. let's go.

name: astronomer_5
description: standing, a little awkwardly, but happily here.

name: knife
description: a little pocket knife with a sharp blade.

name: astronomers_laptop
description: a scrappy machine, running linux. a hand-made GPS ping program is open on it.

name: broken_star_projector
description: a light shines into a dome of cut stars. it is missing the glass cover.
onVerb_description: you carefully remove the glass bulb from its metal base. it requires some convincing, but you manage to fit it onto the star projector. it is not a perfect fit, and the galaxy is a little skewed and blurred. but it is still recognizably itself.

name: star_projector
description: a light projects outwards from a dome of cut stars. pinpricks of light are cast on every surface.

name: telescope
description: a star-tracking model. it moves itself slowly, lens pointed at the rock ceiling. locked onto a celestial object that it cannot see.

name: star_map
description: creased, much amended, notes in pencil and in pen.
onVerb_description: unfolding the star map on the floor

name: filing_cabinet_1
description: a complicated categorization system. over your head.

name: filing_cabinet_2
description: cards upon cards upon cards. they've been neatly edited and amended over time, as archived things find their places and as the system changes to encompass them.

name: north
description: archive north

name: south
description: archive south

name: stacks_L_1
description: aa-ce
onVerb_description: drawer full of shiny seeds. compact, organized, pressed into labelled hollows. live oak. white oak. burr oak.|you press a button and a speaker begins to play a catchy jingle for apocalypse shelters. buy now, never worry again. the underground complex includes a swimming pool.|this drawer is a horizontal ant farm. their tunnels run the width of the drawer, sandwiched between two plates of glass.|login keys for the old bulletin board system, before you got personal mail running.|a piece of trinitite. fused, green, malevolent.|years of transcripts from the weekly radio play. you flip to "may 8, 2006" and read a half a page. it is an adaptation of cat's cradle. you put it back.

name: stacks_L_2
description: ce-fa
onVerb_description: drawer full of keys and key fobs. each one has a label with its car's location in the tunnels.|teletype printouts. you pick one up at random: "...the computer enables the creation of a communal memory bank, accessible to anyone in the community... invite your participation and suggestions..."|a friendly robotic voice: "keep left at the fork. your destination will be on your right."|drawer full of clear, pungent liquid.

name: stacks_L_3
description: fa-ho
onVerb_description: your mind wanders. a salad. a sunny afternoon. someone in your bed.|a slip of paper with the word "FOG" written on it in red ink. you flip it over. on the back is written: "an atmospheric phenomenon of condensed water vapor. a terrestrial cloud."

name: stacks_L_4
description: ho-li
onVerb_description: a map of the orbit trajectories of the debris field around earth. you can barely see the planet for the plotted lines.|another drawer of car keys. these are labelled with their associated duplicates in [classic cars]|drawer full of astroturf.

name: stacks_R_1
description: li-pa

name: stacks_R_2
description: pa-sa
onVerb_description: a telephone receiver. you pick it up to a tinny conversation between two voices. they are discussing canning tomatoes. you set it back down.|the entire drawer is paneled in reflective glass. it feels warm to the touch.|book of best practices for the the on-air personality.|carded fibers in dozens of materials, in hundreds of colors.|an air compressor kit, fitted with a garden hose attachment.

name: stacks_R_3
description: sa-ve
onVerb_description: the whole cabinet is full of coiled, barnacle-encrusted, rope.|little mud houses, like the kinds children would make on the playground after a night of rain.|a sample of caesium-133, suspended in glass.|a pomegranate, split in half. the seeds look like garnets in the gloom.

name: stacks_R_4
description: ve-zy
onVerb_description: twenty years of mail-order catalogs. "Hits of 1966". | "How shall we collect the garbage? A study in economic organization". published in 1972. |the drawer is full of clear spring water. you touch it, and your hand comes up wet.

name: vinyl_record
description: a flat disk of pressed plastic. the label is worn off.

name: north
description: archive north

name: south
description: archive south

name: airplane_fuselage
description: a small passenger plane, missing its wings. the librarian lives in here.

name: tree_trunk
description: a slice of an enormous redwood tree. the rings are marked‚Äì you counted up to 850, once.

name: record_player
description: a magnavox portable player. it is painted baby blue.

name: taxidermy_bird
description: a stuffed canary, wired to a perch in an ornate cage.
onVerb_description: a music-box hidden somewhere in the base of the cage begins to spin. little pinging notes echo off the tunnel walls.

name: north
description: archive north

name: librarian
description: a severe countenance only slightly interrupted by the smile lines.

name: librarian_2
description: a severe countenance only slightly interrupted by the smile lines.

name: librarian_3
description: a severe countenance only slightly interrupted by the smile lines.

name: librarian_4
description: reading a novel.

name: librarian_5
description: novel still in hand.

name: librarian_dialog_1
description: ah, welcome back to the archives. | we have a new categorization scheme. browse the stacks if you'd like.

name: librarian_dialog_2
description: did you look through the archives? I think this system might stick. | or can I help you find something?
replies: well... I was wondering about music.

name: librarian_dialog_3
description: music? we have all sorts! try b for broadcast, r for radio, or v for vinyl.

name: librarian_dialog_4
description: hm, I'll be honest... I'm not sure what's on it. | but I do have a record player. we could find out.
replies: could I borrow the player? it's for angela's birthday party...

name: librarian_dialog_5
description: you want to borrow the record player? like... a loan? | well. well, well, well. | we haven't had a loan request in quite some time. but it's possible. it's possible. | I just need you to sign up for a library card.

name: librarian_dialog_6
description: it's absolutely necessary. I can't loan things out willy-nilly. come back with .. um ... a photo id? or, well, a photograph anyway.

name: librarian_dialog_7
description: oh, you brought it! that's a nice photograph of you.|this'll do. let me just write the date of the loan on the back... and the item loaned... | and there we go. that's a library card if I've ever seen one. | go ahead and borrow the record player!

name: librarian_dialog_8
description: hmm... I hear the party's on. | let's go hear that record play, yes?

name: radio_transmitter
description: the vhs player is hooked up to it.

name: radio_transmitter_2
description: the astronomer's laptop is hooked up to it.

name: astronomers_laptop_2
description: a scrappy machine, running linux. a hand-made GPS ping program is open on it.
onVerb_description: running program...

description: there's a small display screen; it is currently playing a documentary about a woman who rehabilitates owls.

onVerb_description: you push a tape into the deck.|you push a tape into the deck.|you push a tape into the deck.

description: a shelf of a few hundred vhs tapes. you browse the hand-written titles.
verbs_display: the name of the rose|bonsai for the home gardener|mad max
onVerb_description: you pull a tape off the shelf.|you pull a tape off the shelf.|you pull a tape off the shelf.

name: generator_1
description: these were designed to run on ethanol, but have been modified for broader fare.

name: north
description: following the tunnel north

name: south
description: following the tunnel south

name: generator_1
description: for a while these burned waste scraps, to limited success.

name: generator_2
description: now they're running on an algae biofuel.

name: generator_3
description: making low machine sounds.

name: north
description: following the tunnel north

name: south
description: following the tunnel south

name: generator_1
description: heat.

name: generator_2
description: clicks.

name: generator_3
description: humming.

name: generator_5
description: fans.

name: generator_6
description: whirrs.

name: north
description: following the tunnel north

name: south
description: following the tunnel south

name: generator_open
description: the whole face of the machine has been taken off. it is laying on the ground. tubes and copper wires have been pulled out. there is a pool of blue-green liquid on the floor. it all looks... haphazard.
onVerb_description: it's going to be a patch job, but you'll do your best. you lay out your tools and get to work. carefully, you reseat housing and reattach cables, but there's only so much you can do with what is already here.

name: generator_open_2
description: some attempts have been made at piecing things back together, but the machine is decidedly not running. algae is dripping out of a severed tube.
onVerb_description: you patch in the plastic tubing. it feels a little visceral, but eventually you turn on the filtration system. it holds. a blessing.

name: generator_fixed
description: patched, working.

name: generator_empty
description: it is not running. but it is in one piece.
onVerb_description: you open the machine and pour in the fresh algae colony.

name: generator_still
description: it is not running. but it is in one piece.
onVerb_description: you insert the button into a port on the front and the machine begins to pulse into life.

name: generator_running
description: it gives off the faintest glow.

name: ed_lorris
description: a slight man. freckled. arms covered in algae and engine grease.

name: ed_lorris_dialog_1
description: ah, you came. good. good.|though. perhaps... a bit too late. I got impatient. waiting, that is.

name: ed_lorris_dialog_2
description: but I've got a lead! on our broken generators. or, to say it differently; I've found the problem. internally.

name: ed_lorris_dialog_3
description: it's a simple problem! algae die-off. could have happened to any of them, really. | we just pulled too much power. processed too much. little buggers couldn't keep up multiplying.|we just need a new bucket of algae! pond should get us sorted on the bucket front.

name: ed_lorris_dialog_4
description: or... that's all we need for, um, the generator that I didn't take apart looking for the problem. | the other one... might need a little more work.|... sorry.

name: ed_lorris_2
description: beaming.

name: ed_lorris_dialog_5
description: oh my lord, you actually fixed it. | I mean... I knew it was fixable. and I knew you were the one for the job! | though... maybe... don't tell anyone about this, okay? | ah, shoot, and here's the ignition button. forgot I had it in my pocket. maybe you need it for the other one?

name: ignition_button
description: a little plastic key.

name: ed_lorris_3
description: a slight man. freckled. arms covered in algae and engine grease.

name: ed_lorris_dialog_6
description: angela's party is starting? and I'm invited? | well, hot damn!

name: ed_lorris_4
description: hands in his pockets, hair combed back.

name: north
description: following the tunnel north

name: lake
onVerb_description: you dip your bucket into the surface.

name: boulder_1
description: sticking out of the inky water.

name: boulder_2
description: a barely visible island in the dark.

name: lamp_on
description: a low, steady light casting shadows on the surface of the lake.
onVerb_description: the light doesn't reach the ceiling, and with the smell of the water you could almost imagine you were outside.|you reach down and, with one deft motion, sever the cord.

name: lamp_off
description: a dimmed lamp.

name: algae
description: in the sudden darkness it blooms like an aurora, swirling patterns made of millions of pinpricks. dizzying. the floor becomes the sky.
onVerb_description: you dip your bucket into the swell and it sends of waves out like fireworks, the rippling water catching the glow. the bucket glows too. full of light.

name: water
description: clear and cold.

name: tunnel_wall_left
description: you run your fingers along it.

name: tunnel_wall_right
description: rough-cut stone.

description: going to the court

description: going back to the tunnel

name: abels_rv
description: a winnebago, boxy and tall. a bedroll has been set up on the roof.
onVerb_description: you unlock abel's front door and go inside.

name: cains_rv
description: a ford truck, painted with tulips. a set of wooden stairs lead up the front door.
onVerb_description: you unlock cain's front door and go inside.

name: palm_tree
description: hung with christmas ornaments.

name: picnic_table
description: still sporting unwashed dishes from a shared meal.

name: cupboard
description: clapboard‚Äì held together with zipties.
onVerb_description: you slide open the bottom drawer. nestled amongst the sweaters is a light bulb.

name: teapot
description: overly ornate. porcelain, painted daisies.

name: table
description: round, set for two.

name: potted plant
description: a monstera. one big leaf, with a grow light positioned just above it.

name: bed
description: neatly made. positioned above the driver's seat.

name: door
description: going to the court

name: abels_light_bulb
description: an incandescent bulb, wrapped carefully in a piece of old paper.

name: bookshelf
description: lacquered bamboo‚Äì sporting a few books, but far more odds and ends.
onVerb_description: romance novels. guitar strings. a whole shelf of shoes. ah‚Äì and a light bulb.

name: guitar
description: not a speck of dust on it.
onVerb_description: you don't play, but even running your hand across the strings makes a pleasant sound.

name: framed photograph
description: it's abel.

name: couch
description: a down comforter is folded at one end, and a pillow is at the other.

name: door
description: going to the court

name: cains_light_bulb
description: an incandescent bulb‚Äì a few scratches, but perfectly functional.

description: following the tunnel north

name: south
description: going to the lake

description: inset with small divots.

name: tunnel_wall_right
description: your palm against the rock.

name: north
description: following the tunnel north

name: houseboat
description: mr. pond lives here. all hung with nets and homemade tackle.

name: pier
description: a fragile little jetty pushing out into the water.

name: lake
description: vast. inky. stretching out from the tunnels into the darkness of the mine.
onVerb_description: your voice echoes back, distorted and booming.|you sing a few lines of an old hymn - it sounds like you are singing with a choir.

name: bucket
description: a plastic pail, light and useful.

name: camera
description: a polaroid camera. plastic, square.

name: mr_pond
description: the night fisherman.

name: mr_pond_2
description: the night fisherman.
onVerb_description: |you hand over the pumpkin you harvested from the community gardens. mr. pond makes to speak.

name: mr_pond_3
description: the slightest smile.

name: mr_pond_4
description: the night fisherman.

name: mr_pond_5
description: the night fisherman.

name: mr_pond_6
description: birthday candle in hand.

name: mr_pond_dialog_1
description: . . . evening.
replies: hello, mr. pond | catch anything today, mr. pond?

name: mr_pond_dialog_3
description: nothing . . . worth the keeping. | trash . . . and junk. | sick . . . of fish anyway. | what I wouldn't give . . . for a vegetable.

name: mr_pond_dialog_4
description: oh . . . it's . . . a beautiful pumpkin.|. . . here. take this. | . . . fished it out . . . yesterday. | might . . . even work. haven't . . . tried.
